tool.name: MSIsensor msi
tool.description: Detect replication slippage variants at microsatellite regions.
tool.command:
ln -s '${normal}' normal.bam && samtools index normal.bam && ln -s '${tumor}' tumor.bam && samtools index tumor.bam && msisensor msi
-d '${microsat_ref}' -n normal.bam -t tumor.bam -o output
#if $bedfile: -e '${bedfile}' #end if
#if $region: -r '${region}' #end if
-f '${fdr_thresh}' -c '${cov_thresh}' -l '${min_hp}' -p '${min_hp_dist}' -m '${max_hp_dist}' -q '${min_ms}' -s '${min_ms_dist}' -w '${max_ms_dist}' -u '${span_size}'
-b "\${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4}"
#if $output_hp_only: -x '1' #else -x '0' #end if
#if $output_ms_only: -y '1' #else -y '0' #end if

param.name: fdr_thresh
param.label: FDR Threshold
param.help: FDR threshold for somatic sites detection

param.name: cov_thresh
param.label: Coverage Threshold
param.help: coverage threshold for msi analysis, WXS: 20; WGS: 15

param.name: min_hp_dist
param.label: Min Homopolymer Size DA
param.help: minimal homopolymer size for distribution analysis

param.name: max_hp_dist
param.label: Max Homopolymer Size DA
param.help: maximal homopolymer size for distribution analysis

param.name: min_ms_dist
param.label: Min Microsat Size DA
param.help: minimal microsats size for distribution analysis

param.name: max_ms_dist
param.label: Max Microsat Size DA
param.help: maximal microsats size for distribution analysis

param.name: span_size
param.label: Span Size
param.help: span size around window for extracting reads

tool.help:
MSIsensor is a C++ program to detect replication slippage variants at microsatellite regions, and differentiate them as somatic or germline. Given paired tumor and normal sequence data, it builds a distribution for expected (normal) and observed (tumor) lengths of repeated sequence per microsatellite, and compares them using Pearson's Chi-Squared Test. Comprehensive testing indicates MSIsensor is an efficient and effective tool for deriving MSI status from standard tumor-normal paired sequence data.
If you used this tool for your work, please cite PMID 24371154.
